nodes.bodyText: I guess commented out code could be removed.
Fixed
Why was subject_type removed from the required-list? Does this have something to do with populating ServiceClient-objects before knowing the type for some reason?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5376,7 +5376,6 @@ components:
       description: service client. May be a subsystem, local group, or a global group
       required:
         - id
-        - subject_type

nodes.bodyText: The refactored endpoints do not use subject_type for anything, since subject_type can be derived from the encoded id. I wanted to make life easier for the API user and not require subject_type when it is not necessary.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5376,7 +5376,6 @@ components:
       description: service client. May be a subsystem, local group, or a global group
       required:
         - id
-        - subject_type

nodes.bodyText: Method doesn't throw EndpointNotFoundException anymore.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -102,80 +106,99 @@ public AccessRightService(GlobalConfFacade globalConfFacade,
      * @param clientId
      * @param fullServiceCode
      * @param subjectIds
-     * @param localGroupIds
      * @throws AccessRightNotFoundException if tried to remove access rights that did not exist for the service
      * @throws ClientNotFoundException if client with given id was not found
-     * @throws ServiceNotFoundException if service with given fullServicecode was not found
+     * @throws ServiceNotFoundException if service with given fullServicecode, or the base endpoint for it,
+     * was not found
      * @throws EndpointNotFoundException if the base endpoint for the service is not found

nodes.bodyText: Good point. Moving.
Fixed
Adding description to this private methods would be more consistent as all other private methods have a description also. Nevertheless the method name is quite descriptive in itself.
Adding.
Fixed
accessRightsToBeRemoved is a bit missleading name here as this method is just for getting accessrighs and not about removing them.
Yeah, remnants of before it was refactored into separate method, or something. Fixing.
Fixed

Is there something missing from this comment?
Also this method in general makes me think if it should be in ClientService?
Yes, it should be in ClientService. Changing clientService.getLocalClientOrThrowNotFound to a public method.
Fixed
I'm not quite sure why this method is changed to package private, instead of just public?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -328,7 +420,7 @@ private boolean isValidServiceClientType(XRoadObjectType objectType) {
      * @param accessRightTypes
      * @return
      */
-    public List<ServiceClientDto> mapAccessRightsToServiceClients(ClientType clientType,
+    List<ServiceClientDto> mapAccessRightsToServiceClients(ClientType clientType,

nodes.bodyText:
I believe my thinking was that it is only used from other service, and is probably not useful for any controllers, so visibility should be as limited as possible. To keep service's interface to controllers a bit simpler.
On the other hand there are probably lots of other similar methods that should be package private by this logic, so I am not sure if the change makes much sense. Keeping it there anyway, comment if you think it should be changed to public.

      * @param accessRightTypes
      * @return
      */
-    public List<ServiceClientDto> mapAccessRightsToServiceClients(ClientType clientType,
+    List<ServiceClientDto> mapAccessRightsToServiceClients(ClientType clientType,

nodes.bodyText: Yes. I think reading the service layer classes would actually be easier if all the methods used only in service layer would be package private. But I think this is just fine right now.
